summary: The Shutdown Fairness Act (S.3012) addresses payment for federal employees during government shutdowns. It mandates appropriations to pay excepted employees, including contractors and active-duty military, for work performed during a lapse in appropriations. The bill defines "excepted employees" and "excepted work," specifies the appropriations process, and outlines the conditions under which the funds become available and are terminated. It also includes a retroactive effective date of September 30, 2025.
